snippet: An Egyptian court has overturned a year-old ban on the ritual cutting of female genitals in a decision that has been celebrated by Islamic leaders but has outraged human rights advocates.    The decision on Tuesday struck down a ban on the traditi...
lead_paragraph: An Egyptian court has overturned a year-old ban on the ritual cutting of female genitals in a decision that has been celebrated by Islamic leaders but has outraged human rights advocates. The decision on Tuesday struck down a ban on the traditional practice in all state and private clinics. But it maintained a ban on cutting as practiced by people untrained in medicine, including the midwives and barbers who use razors and other crude devices in rural villages.
abstract: Egyptian court overturns year-old ban on ritual cutting of female genitals in all state and private clinics; maintains ban on cutting as practiced by untrained people in rural villages; Islamic leaders hail ruling; human rights advocates score it (M)

headline.main: Egyptian Court Overturns Ban On Cutting of Girls' Genitals

snippet: " Have you any notion how many books are written about women in the course of one year? Have you any notion how many are written by men? Are you aware that you are, perhaps, the most discussed animal in the universe?" So Virginia Woolf, in 1929, w...
lead_paragraph: " Have you any notion how many books are written about women in the course of one year? Have you any notion how many are written by men? Are you aware that you are, perhaps, the most discussed animal in the universe?" So Virginia Woolf, in 1929, was provoked to a cry of exasperation: just give us "A Room of One's Own," and as you leave, shut the door.
abstract: paperback book sec (part 2)

headline.main: Female Human Beings; Female Human Beings

snippet: Egypt's revolutionaries have been left out in the cold by mainstream Egyptians, who now favor stability over more radical change....
lead_paragraph: CAIRO - When I first met Sally Toma last year, she was flush with victory. After 18 days of protests in Tahrir Square, Hosni Mubarak, Egypt's long-time strongman, had been toppled and the credit went to the Coalition of Revolution Youth, the 17-member committee of representatives from different youth groups that had started the protests. Toma, a 33-year-old psychiatrist, was the only woman and Coptic Christian member.
abstract: Egypt's revolutionaries have been left out in the cold by mainstream Egyptians, who now favor stability over more radical change.

headline.main: What a Difference a Year Makes

headline.main: Investigators Say Mexico Has Thwarted Efforts to Solve Students’ Disappearance
headline.print_headline: Mexico Obstructs Inquiry of Abductions, Panel Says

snippet: On the desk is a brand new report on violation of human rights around the world. It is one of the most saddening documents of its kind I have read -- for what is not in it.   In its 389 pages the report details human rights abuses country by count...
lead_paragraph: On the desk is a brand new report on violation of human rights around the world. It is one of the most saddening documents of its kind I have read -- for what is not in it. In its 389 pages the report details human rights abuses country by country. It includes a special report devoted to the particular human rights problems of women.

headline.main: On My Mind; Female Genital Mutilation

snippet: In a surprising break with its march toward states' rights, the Supreme Court ruled today that states can be sued for violating their employees' federally guaranteed right to take time off for family emergencies.    The vote to reject Nevada's cla...
lead_paragraph: In a surprising break with its march toward states' rights, the Supreme Court ruled today that states can be sued for violating their employees' federally guaranteed right to take time off for family emergencies. The vote to reject Nevada's claim to constitutional immunity from suit under the Family and Medical Leave Act was a decisive 6 to 3. Most unexpectedly, the author of the majority opinion was Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist, under whose leadership the court has produced a series of bitterly contested 5-to-4 decisions expanding the scope of the states' immunity from suit and, correspondingly, curbing the power of Congress to make federal law fully binding.
abstract: Supreme Court, in surprising break with its march toward states' rights, rules 6-3 that states can be sued for violating employees' federally guaranteed right to take time off for family emergencies; Chief Justice William Rehnquist is unexpected author of majority ruling rejecting Nevada's claim of constitutional immunity from suit under Family and Medical Leave Act; majority finds federal law narrowly targeted to address persistent, well-documented workplace problem of gender-based discrimination which assumes that caring for family is women's work; suit was brought by male employee, William Hibbs, who was dismissed after taking time off to care for ailing wife; photo (M)

headline.main: JUSTICES, 6-3, RULE WORKERS CAN SUE STATES OVER LEAVE

snippet: There were photographs at the human rights center here Sunday: of fingers with deep infected gouges; of an imprisoned husband; of the corpse of a former Iraqi general who died late last year in American custody, the swollen pink zipper of an autop...
lead_paragraph: There were photographs at the human rights center here Sunday: of fingers with deep infected gouges; of an imprisoned husband; of the corpse of a former Iraqi general who died late last year in American custody, the swollen pink zipper of an autopsy cut running from his groin to his neck. There was also much screaming.
abstract: Scandal at Abu Ghraib prison gives new platform to human rights groups and Iraqi leaders who have been complaining for months to American officials about treatment of prisoners; they say their appeals have received little attention, and concede their complaints are not as serious as images world is seeing of naked prisoners in hoods and young female soldier holding one by leash; Defense Sec Donald H Rumsfeld's promise to pay compensation to victims may make it hard to separate victims from opportunists; Abu Ghraib photographs seem to confirm worst of what many Iraqis believe and some have experienced: that American soldiers, under extreme danger and thus usually seen patrolling streets with guns raised, often use excessive force against Iraqis; at news conference organized by Organization for Human Rights in Iraq, many of complaints concern rough-handed arrests and inability to see loved ones in jail; several people say they are victims of more serious abuses and at least two say their relatives are among those who died while in American custody; photos (M)

headline.main: Brutal Images Buttress Anger Of Ex-Prisoners
headline.kicker: THE STRUGGLE FOR IRAQ: HUMAN RIGHTS

snippet: To the Editor:    Re your Sept. 11 front-page profile of Fauziya Kassindja and her claim for political asylum based on fear of genital mutilation: The new anti-terrorism law, which would allow fleeing refugees to be denied entry without a hearing ...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re your Sept. 11 front-page profile of Fauziya Kassindja and her claim for political asylum based on fear of genital mutilation: The new anti-terrorism law, which would allow fleeing refugees to be denied entry without a hearing if they are using false documents, would most likely have returned Ms. Kassindja to her home country. Indeed, she had a false Nigerian passport. She was also making a new legal claim for immigration, increasing her chance of being returned.
abstract: Prof Lenni B Benson letter comments on Sept 11 article on Fauziya Kassindja, Togo citizen who was granted asylum in US because of her fear of practice in Togo of female genital mutilation (S)

lead_paragraph: The case has received extraordinary attention because it unfolded as Israel passed a law concerning the force-feeding of hunger strikers.
abstract: Hunger strike by Palestinian prisoner Mohammad Allan has handed Israeli authorities difficult decision of yielding to his demand to be freed from administrative detention or resorting to force feeding him; Allan has been on hunger strike since June 16, and his case has drawn widespread international and domestic attention, in part because of controversial law passed by Israel to allow force-feeding of those on hunger strike; law has been condemned by Israel's medical association and by international human-rights groups.

headline.main: One Palestinian’s Refusal to Eat Puts Israel in a Bind

lead_paragraph: A referendum on Tuesday on an anti-discrimination measure, one that opponents say goes too far, has become a widely watched battle over transgender and gay rights.
abstract: Upcoming referendum to keep or repeal Houston's equal rights ordinance has sparked costly battle between some of city's most powerful conservatives and lesbian Mayor Annise D Parker and her supporters; opponents have narrowed discussion of law's broad protections to issue of gender identity, using advertising tactics that equate transgender men with sexual predators; bitter fight has turned local ordinance into referendum on gay and transgender rights being watched across nation.

headline.main: Tactics and Antagonists Draw Attention to Houston Rights Vote
headline.print_headline: Tactics and Antagonists Draw Attention to Houston Vote on Rights Law

snippet: Fauziya Kasinga, who sought sanctuary in the United States in 1994, saying she was escaping her African tribe's custom of mutilating the genitals of young  women, was released by Federal immigration authorities yesterday after more than a year of ...
lead_paragraph: Fauziya Kasinga, who sought sanctuary in the United States in 1994, saying she was escaping her African tribe's custom of mutilating the genitals of young women, was released by Federal immigration authorities yesterday after more than a year of sometimes harsh confinement in a detention center in New Jersey and prisons in Pennsylvania. Immigration officials said they decided to free Ms. Kasinga, 19, of Togo, because she has developed strong ties in recent months to religious and human rights groups who have promised to support her and insure she shows up for legal hearings. The officials phoned her lawyers yesterday with the decision and then told Ms. Kasinga.

headline.main: U.S. Frees African Fleeing Ritual Mutilation

snippet: Women in the state are the voice of protest and change....
lead_paragraph: India is the land of a million mutinies, in V. S. Naipaul's indelible phrase, but almost all the mutinies I have witnessed have been led and populated by men. When the farmers of Uttar Pradesh demonstrate against a new highway, they leave their wives at home. When the Jats agitate for caste-based job and education preferences by sitting on railway tracks, their daughters remain in the village, their faces, in all likelihood, covered by dupattas.
abstract: Women in the state are the voice of protest and change.

headline.main: In Manipur, Women Take the Lead

abstract: Arrest and imprisonment of five feminist activists in China has started international backlash in support of women, despite Chinese authorities' attempts to hush story; crackdown on activists Li Tinting, Wei Tingting, Wu Rongrong, Wang Man and Zheng Churan is seen as indicator of increased crackdown on grassroots activism under Pres Xi Jinping.

snippet: An unpublished United Nations report found that 70 percent of the policewomen interviewed had personally experienced sexual harassment or sexual violence....
lead_paragraph: An unpublished United Nations report found that 70 percent of the policewomen interviewed had personally experienced sexual harassment or sexual violence.
abstract: Unpublished United Nations report on female police officers in Afghanistan finds accounts of pervasive sexual violence and harassment from male colleagues; says that about 70 percent of the policewomen interviewed have personally experienced sexual harassment or sexual violence on the job.

headline.main: Afghan Policewomen Say Sexual Harassment Is Rife
headline.print_headline: Afghan Policewomen Say Sexual Harassment Is Rife

snippet: The central moral struggle of the 19th century concerned slavery, and that of the 20th pitted democracy against Nazism, Communism and other despotic isms. Our own pre-eminent moral challenge will be to ease the brutality that kills and maims girls...
lead_paragraph: The central moral struggle of the 19th century concerned slavery, and that of the 20th pitted democracy against Nazism, Communism and other despotic isms. Our own pre-eminent moral challenge will be to ease the brutality that kills and maims girls and women across much of Africa and Asia. Alas, this summer President Bush is putting the U.S. on the wrong side of the battle lines.
abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column says health and welfare of women, particularly in Third World, is key issue of new century and Pres Bush is repeatedly putting United States on wrong side of battle lines by thwarting international efforts and cutting off aid; says that 500,00 women die each year in pregnancy or childbirth; that 100 million women and girls worldwide are 'missing' because they are denied food or medical care, or because they are aborted or killed at birth because they are female; and that between one and two million girls and women are trafficked into prostitution annually (M)

headline.main: Bush vs. Women

snippet: The Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Ms. Yousafzai, 17, underscores the disproportionate expectations surrounding a rights activist who has yet to graduate from high school....
lead_paragraph: The Nobel Peace Prize awarded to Ms. Yousafzai, 17, underscores the disproportionate expectations surrounding a rights activist who has yet to graduate from high school.
abstract: Malala Yousafzai, youngest winner of Nobel Peace Prize, began campaigning for girls’ education at the age of 11, three years before she was shot by the Taliban; prize validates her battle, but also underscores the disproportionate expectations that trail a human rights activist who has not yet completed high school.

headline.main: Malala Yousafzai, Youngest Nobel Peace Prize Winner, Adds to Her Achievements and Expectations
headline.print_headline: Added to High School Pressure: the Expectations That Follow a Peace Laureate

snippet: Two generations after Simone de Beauvoir helped to inspire the feminist revolution after World War II, Sheryl K. Sandberg has written a book arguing a similar case today....
lead_paragraph: Two generations after Simone de Beauvoir helped to inspire the feminist revolution after World War II, Sheryl K. Sandberg has written a book arguing a similar case today.

headline.main: In Sandberg, Echoes of De Beauvoir
headline.print_headline: In Sandberg, Echoes of De Beauvoir

snippet: China is among the few countries where women are experiencing a rights rollback, according to feminists, researchers and data from the All-China Women's Federation, a state-run entity....
lead_paragraph: China is among the few countries where women are experiencing a rights rollback, according to feminists, researchers and data from the All-China Women's Federation, a state-run entity.

headline.main: Chinese Women’s Progress Stalls on Many Fronts
headline.print_headline: Chinese Women's Progress Stalls in Varied Standards

snippet: The Chinese president’s remarks came at a United Nations conference Sunday where world leaders promised to change their laws and practices to advance gender equality....
lead_paragraph: The Chinese president’s remarks came at a United Nations conference Sunday where world leaders promised to change their laws and practices to advance gender equality.
abstract: Chinese Pres Xi Jinping promises to reaffirm his government's commitment to gender equality at United Nations conference of global leaders, which marks 20th anniversary of landmark UN summit in Beijing regarding gender equality; analysts say event, which was jointly hosted by China, was meant to showcase China's ascendancy, but highlighted tensions over human rights issues between United States and China.

headline.main: Xi Jinping Vows to ‘Reaffirm’ China’s Commitment to Women’s Rights
headline.print_headline: Xi Vows to ‘Reaffirm’ Women’s Rights Efforts

snippet: A parks department accommodation to Orthodox Jews violates the rights of others who just want to cool off....
lead_paragraph: A parks department accommodation to Orthodox Jews violates the rights of others who just want to cool off.
abstract: Editorial objects to New York City parks department's decision to allow women-only swimming hours at public swimming pool in Brooklyn; argues rule, which was instituted at request of Orthodox Jewish community, unjustly restricts secular space for religious reasons.

headline.main: Everybody Into the Pool
headline.print_headline: Everybody Into the Pool

snippet: Gloria Steinem occupies a singular place in American culture as the very face of feminism....
lead_paragraph: Gloria Steinem occupies a singular place in American culture as the very face of feminism.
abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column assesses Gloria Steinem's singular place in American culture, in light of her 80th birthday; contends she is the very face of feminism.

headline.main: This Is What 80 Looks Like
headline.print_headline: This Is What 80 Looks Like

snippet: Claiming the Quran’s support, the Islamic State codifies sex slavery in conquered regions of Iraq and Syria and uses the practice as a recruiting tool....
lead_paragraph: Claiming the Quran’s support, the Islamic State codifies sex slavery in conquered regions of Iraq and Syria and uses the practice as a recruiting tool.
abstract: Islamic State has established vast system of rape among enslaved women and girls from Yazidi religious minority; community leaders say 5,270 Yazidis were abducted in 2014, and at least 3,144 are still being held by militants; practice of sexual slavery has been enshrined in core tenets of ISIS and is being used as recruiting tool to lure conservative Muslim men (Series: State of Terror).

headline.main: ISIS Enshrines a Theology of Rape
headline.print_headline: Enslaving Young Girls, the Islamic State Builds a Vast System of Rape

snippet: Two Times journalists looked at how Madonna’s recent speech about sexism put Hillary Clinton’s candidacy in fresh perspective....
lead_paragraph: Two Times journalists looked at how Madonna’s recent speech about sexism put Hillary Clinton’s candidacy in fresh perspective.

headline.main: Madonna and Hillary: ‘Witch’ and ‘Nasty Woman’ as Sisters in Arms

snippet: The International Olympic Committee needs a president who cares about human rights....
lead_paragraph: The International Olympic Committee needs a president who cares about human rights.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Minky Worden, Human Rights Watch director, calls on International Olympic Committee to elect president who cares about human rights when it chooses new leader in September; contends organization has had spotty record in past and that new president should be forceful in addressing myriad violations by Russia, which will host 2014 games.

headline.main: The Olympics’ Leadership Mess
headline.print_headline: The Olympics’ Leadership Mess

abstract: The election of an Argentine cardinal as Pope Francis has rekindled a controversy about the role of the Roman Catholic Church during the blackest period of his country’s modern history.

snippet: Jailed girls as young as 13 have been forced to undergo invasive and invalid tests, Afghanistan’s human rights commission said....
lead_paragraph: Jailed girls as young as 13 have been forced to undergo invasive and invalid tests, Afghanistan’s human rights commission said.
abstract: Afghanistan’s Independent Human Rights Commission issues report condemning virginity tests, saying practice is invasive, degrading and scientifically invalid; girls as young as 13 have had to endure tests.

headline.main: Jailed Afghan Women Are Often Subjected to Virginity Tests, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Jailed Afghan Women Are Often Given Virginity Tests

snippet: "The Act of Killing" allows Indonesian gangsters to re-create their killings of communists in 1965, purges left as many as 3 million dead. The gangsters, lionized by many Indonesians, used sets, costumes, makeup and even a song-and-dance number to...
abstract: "The Act of Killing" allows Indonesian gangsters to re-create their killings of communists in 1965, purges left as many as 3 million dead. The gangsters, lionized by many Indonesians, used sets, costumes, makeup and even a song-and-dance number to recount their deeds.

headline.main: From Indonesia, a Documentary With Killers as the Stars

snippet: Fighting Boko Haram effectively requires a government willing and able to take on the security challenge....
lead_paragraph: Fighting Boko Haram effectively requires a government willing and able to take on the security challenge.
abstract: Editorial warns against any delay to presidential and legislative elections in Nigeria, as current government needs to be held accountable for its ineffectual efforts to address threat posed by Boko Haram.

headline.main: In Nigeria, the Terror Continues
headline.print_headline: In Nigeria, the Terror Continues

snippet: A proposal by the human rights group to advocate the elimination of penalties in the sex trade, to be taken up at a conference in Dublin, has drawn denunciation from women’s groups....
lead_paragraph: A proposal by the human rights group to advocate the elimination of penalties in the sex trade, to be taken up at a conference in Dublin, has drawn denunciation from women’s groups.
abstract: Lawmakers in France, England and Ireland are considering measures that would impose penalties on male clients of prostitutes in effort to crack down on trade, while rights group Amnesty International has proposed decriminalizing prostitution worldwide; differing proposals have reignited debate over how to treat one of world's oldest professions.

headline.main: Amnesty International Considers Pushing for Decriminalization of Prostitution
headline.print_headline: Rights Group Weighs New Stance on Prostitution

snippet: Among this year’s subjects: an Afghan rapper whose mother tried to sell her and Chinese women seeking justice in the reported rape of six children....
lead_paragraph: Among this year’s subjects: an Afghan rapper whose mother tried to sell her and Chinese women seeking justice in the reported rape of six children.
abstract: Stephen Holden Critic's Notebook discusses lineup for Human Rights Watch Film Festival, presented by IFC Center and Film Society of Lincoln Center; notes theme for 2016 is women's rights and over half of selections are directed or co-directed by women.

headline.main: At the Human Rights Watch Film Festival, a Lot of the Humans Are Women
headline.print_headline: A Harrowing Focus on Child Brides and Rape

lead_paragraph: Opinions on the American presidential candidate veer from admiration, mostly among women and civil libertarians, to distaste, mostly among male policy makers.

headline.main: Score 1 for Saudi Women's Rights

snippet: The convicts, three foreigners and an Indonesian, were executed by firing squads, an official said, and 10 others are still facing the same fate....
lead_paragraph: The convicts, three foreigners and an Indonesian, were executed by firing squads, an official said, and 10 others are still facing the same fate.
abstract: Indonesia executes three foreigners and one Indonesian for drug crimes, renewing outcry over treatment of foreign criminals during country's war on drugs campaign; officials say they want countries to respect Indonesian law, and are deciding fate of 10 others, mostly foreigners, sentenced to death for drug offensives.

headline.main: Indonesia Executes 4 Prisoners Convicted of Drug Crimes
headline.print_headline: Indonesia Executes 4 Drug Convicts

snippet: Afghanistan’s top female official launched a sustained verbal assault on women’s shelters on Tuesday....
lead_paragraph: Afghanistan’s top female official launched a sustained verbal assault on women’s shelters on Tuesday.

headline.main: Afghan Official Says Women’s Shelters Are Corrupt
headline.print_headline: Women’s Shelters Waste Funds, Afghan Says

snippet: Gloria Steinem was among a group of 30 female peace activists who crossed by bus on Sunday from North Korea to South Korea, calling for an end to unresolved hostility....
lead_paragraph: Gloria Steinem was among a group of 30 female peace activists who crossed by bus on Sunday from North Korea to South Korea, calling for an end to unresolved hostility.
abstract: Group of 30 female peace activists marches through demilitarized zone from North Korea to South Korea to call for formal end to Korean War; unresolved hostilities from war have continued to plague two countries; protest march marks rare moment of agreement between countries in allowing event to proceed.

headline.main: Peace Activists Cross Demilitarized Zone Separating Koreas
headline.print_headline: Female Activists Call for Formal Peace Between Koreas

snippet: In the year after the Dec. 16, 2012, gang rape in Delhi, human rights lawyers and activists say key milestones were reached in the campaign against sexual violence, yet much work needs to be done....
abstract: In the year after the Dec. 16, 2012, gang rape in Delhi, human rights lawyers and activists say key milestones were reached in the campaign against sexual violence, yet much work needs to be done.

headline.print_headline: In Jordan a Struggle for Gender Equality

snippet: Donations to the Clinton Foundation from nations with poor records on women’s rights are causing problems for a candidate expected to run in part as the embodiment of women’s aspirations....
lead_paragraph: Donations to the Clinton Foundation from nations with poor records on women’s rights are causing problems for a candidate expected to run in part as the embodiment of women’s aspirations.
abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton's plan to highlight substantial women's rights record at United Nations gathering is undermined by political attacks on her family's foundation for accepting millions from Middle Eastern nations known for abuse and oppression of women; Republicans have leveraged history of donations to undercut key aspect of Clinton's image as she prepares for likely 2016 presidential campaign.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Faces Test of Record as Women’s Advocate
headline.print_headline: Clinton Faces Test of Record Aiding Women

snippet: A support group in Lahore for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender Pakistanis aims to give a safe space to members as more try to gain family support, even in a climate of religious conservatism....
lead_paragraph: A support group in Lahore for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender Pakistanis aims to give a safe space to members as more try to gain family support, even in a climate of religious conservatism.
abstract: Young gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender Pakistanis, many of whom have been educated in West, seek to foster more acceptance of their sexuality and to carve out identity, even in climate of religious conservatism; secret gay and lesbian support group in city of Lahore aims to offer safe space for its members as they try to gain support from their families, or need place to hide.

headline.seo: Gays in Pakistan Move Cautiously to Gain Acceptance
headline.main: Gay Pakistanis, Still in Shadows, Seek Acceptance
headline.print_headline: Gay Pakistanis, Still in Shadows, Seek Acceptance

snippet: This annual film series, presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the IFC Center, provides a global perspective and a commitment to showcasing work about thorny issues....
lead_paragraph: This annual film series, presented by the Film Society of Lincoln Center and the IFC Center, provides a global perspective and a commitment to showcasing work about thorny issues.
abstract: Stephen Holden Critic's Notebook holds that Human Rights Watch Film Festival, presented by Film Society of Lincoln Center and IFC Center, is most socially important film series in New York City, especially in light of heightened tensions between police and African-American communities.

headline.main: The Human Rights Watch Film Festival Explores Social Justice
headline.print_headline: A Focus on Social Justice

snippet: After a week of intensive negotiations, diplomats here at the World Summit on Sustainable Development arrived at a plan early this morning that is intended to reduce poverty and preserve the earth's natural resources.    The breakthrough came afte...
lead_paragraph: After a week of intensive negotiations, diplomats here at the World Summit on Sustainable Development arrived at a plan early this morning that is intended to reduce poverty and preserve the earth's natural resources. The breakthrough came after diplomats worked late into the night on Tuesday to resolve a dispute over language in the conference's plan on health care for women.
abstract: Diplomats at World Summit on Sustainable Development in Johannesburg agree on plan intended to reduce poverty and preserve earth's natural resources; Russia also announces it will ratify Kyoto Protocol on global warming; developing countries accept Canadian insistence on including human rights language in health care statement so as not to condone practices like female genital mutilation; US and UN officials praise final plan, which is sharply assailed by environmentalists and advocates of the poor; photo (M)

headline.main: Broad Accord Reached at Global Environment Meeting

snippet: The activist, journalist and feminist leader is producing and hosting “Woman,” a new series for this bro-centric cable channel....
lead_paragraph: The activist, journalist and feminist leader is producing and hosting “Woman,” a new series for this bro-centric cable channel.
abstract: Activist and feminist leader Gloria Steinem produces and hosts Viceland television show Woman, focusing on human rights issues and violence against women worldwide; unlikely collaboration with male-dominated network is indicative of shifting views on women she has diligently worked to change.

headline.main: Gloria Steinem Brings Feminism to Viceland
headline.print_headline: Finding Feminism in a Boys’ Club

snippet: President Xi Jinping of China is a co-host of the meeting, even though his country imprisoned five feminists this year, and President Obama will not attend....
lead_paragraph: President Xi Jinping of China is a co-host of the meeting, even though his country imprisoned five feminists this year, and President Obama will not attend.
abstract: United Nations summit meeting commemorating 20th anniversary of landmark Beijing women’s rights conference will not be attended by Pres Obama, but instead by envoy Samantha Power; her plan is to shed light on China’s poor human rights record and global indifference to women’s issues, by blanketing facade of US mission with faces of 20 imprisoned feminists, including three from China, so they are visible to attendees.

headline.main: U.N. Summit Meeting on Women’s Rights Highlights More Tension Between U.S. and China
headline.print_headline: U.N. Meeting on Women’s Rights Brings More Discord for U.S. and China

snippet: More than 200 lawyers and associates have been detained on accusations of exploiting cases to enrich themselves and to attack the Communist Party....
lead_paragraph: More than 200 lawyers and associates have been detained on accusations of exploiting cases to enrich themselves and to attack the Communist Party.
abstract: Chinese lawyers say that Chinese government has mounted broad crackdown on human rights lawyers that is one of most withering assaults on profession in decades; over 200 lawyers have been detained, accused of subversion and of attacking Communist Party; despite campaign, which is meant to diminish so-called rights defense movement, many lawyers refuse to back down, pointing to how significantly Chinese society has changed.

headline.main: China Targeting Rights Lawyers in a Crackdown
headline.print_headline: China Targets Rights Lawyers in Crackdown

snippet: The election of Francis is focusing scrutiny on his role at the Roman Catholic Church in Argentina, which was accused of complicity during a military junta’s violent reign....
lead_paragraph: The election of Francis is focusing scrutiny on his role at the Roman Catholic Church in Argentina, which was accused of complicity during a military junta’s violent reign.
abstract: Election of Francis as pope is focusing new scrutiny on his role in the Roman Catholic Church in Argentina, which has been accused of failing to resist--or even actively supporting--violent military dictatorship in the late 1970s; legacy presents challenge to Francis, who has repeatedly had to dispute claims that he allowed kidnapping of two priests in his order in 1976 at start of Argentina's so-called Dirty War.

headline.seo: Francis Begins Reign as Pope Amid Echoes of Argentina’s Dirty War
headline.main: Starting a Papacy, Amid Echoes of a ‘Dirty War’
headline.print_headline: Starting a Papacy, Amid Echoes of a ‘Dirty War’

snippet: The story of how Iranian agents caught my husband with another woman, threatened to stone him to death and then forced him to denounce me....
lead_paragraph: The story of how Iranian agents caught my husband with another woman, threatened to stone him to death and then forced him to denounce me.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Nobel Peace Prize laureate Shirin Ebadi describes how Iranian authorities used her husband's adultery to force him to publicly denounce her in retaliation for her work as human rights lawyer.

headline.main: Tricked Into Cheating and Sentenced to Death
headline.print_headline: Sex, Spies and Human Rights

snippet: The ordeal of two Afghan girls who were flogged for running away underscores the fact that forced marriage is a cultural norm in parts of Afghanistan....
lead_paragraph: The ordeal of two Afghan girls who were flogged for running away underscores the fact that forced marriage is a cultural norm in parts of Afghanistan.

headline.seo: Afghan Child Brides Escape Marriage, but Not Lashes
headline.main: Child Brides Escape Marriage, but Not Lashes
headline.print_headline: Escaping Marriage, But Not Lashes

snippet: One prisoner has written a memoir of life at Guantánamo that every American should read....
lead_paragraph: One prisoner has written a memoir of life at Guantánamo that every American should read.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column offers reaction to Guantanamo Diary, manuscript by Guantanamo Bay detainee Mohamedou Ould Slahi that is being offered in redacted form following legal battle; says diary documents Slahi's long, unjust detention, during which he suffered torture, sexual abuse and humiliation so severe that he finally offered a false confession.

headline.main: A Detainee’s Diary
headline.print_headline: A Detainee’s Diary

snippet: The decision alarmed activists who had celebrated the guilty verdicts as a warning to all those who would seek to reverse the strides made by women in Afghanistan in the past 12 years....
lead_paragraph: The decision alarmed activists who had celebrated the guilty verdicts as a warning to all those who would seek to reverse the strides made by women in Afghanistan in the past 12 years.
abstract: Court in Afghanistan reverses convictions of three Afghans jailed for torturing a young relative who had refused to become a prostitute, alarming activists who had celebrated guilty verdicts as a warning to all those who would seek to reverse strides made by Afghan women.

headline.main: Afghan Court Reverses Convictions in Torture of Girl
headline.print_headline: Afghan Court Reverses Convictions in Torture of Girl

snippet: The show’s closing has prompted debate about the legacy of the playwright Wendy Wasserstein....
lead_paragraph: The show’s closing has prompted debate about the legacy of the playwright Wendy Wasserstein.
abstract: Broadway revival of Wendy Wasserstein play The Heidi Chronicles, which is set to close after only 80 performances, has spurred discussion about how feminism has evolved over the years.

headline.main: ‘The Heidi Chronicles’ Is Trailed by Questions of Feminism and Legacy
headline.print_headline: Questions of Feminism and Legacy Trail a Play

lead_paragraph: Signs are everywhere that a rollback of women’s rights has begun.

headline.main: In Afghanistan, Women Betrayed
headline.print_headline: In Afghanistan, Women Betrayed

snippet: In a country where unmarried mothers are condemned as prostitutes, the nonprofit group Solidarité Féminine is a source of empowerment for unwed single mothers....
lead_paragraph: In a country where unmarried mothers are condemned as prostitutes, the nonprofit group Solidarité Féminine is a source of empowerment for unwed single mothers.

headline.print_headline: Help for Unwed Mothers in Morocco

snippet: Exhilarated by the Supreme Court’s endorsement of same-sex marriage, gay rights advocates have turned their sights on what they see as the next big battle: antidiscrimination laws....
lead_paragraph: Exhilarated by the Supreme Court’s endorsement of same-sex marriage, gay rights advocates have turned their sights on what they see as the next big battle: antidiscrimination laws.
abstract: Gay rights leaders, fresh from Supreme Court victory, are now moving to obtain federal, state and local protections barring discrimination against gays; will seek to establish equality laws in employment, housing, commerce and in other areas that already block discrimination based on race, religion and sex; fight will pit advocate against same religious conservatives who staunchly opposed same-sex marriage.

headline.main: Next Fight for Gay Rights: Bias in Jobs and Housing
headline.print_headline: Next Fight for Gay Rights: Bias in Jobs and Housing

snippet: Many women took the entrenched discrimination for granted, but I didn't....
lead_paragraph: Many women took the entrenched discrimination for granted, but I didn't.

headline.main: China’s Feminist Awakening
headline.print_headline: China's Feminist Awakening

snippet: Despite progress for women on other fronts, violence is a persistent problem, with about 35 percent of women saying they have been attacked, a United Nations report says....
lead_paragraph: Despite progress for women on other fronts, violence is a persistent problem, with about 35 percent of women saying they have been attacked, a United Nations report says.
abstract: United Nations report assesses global progress toward women's equality since 1995 Beijing conference; finds that, despite gains in many areas, level of violence against women remains 'alarmingly high' in all countries; notes also that rise in 'extremism and conservatism' contributes to degradation of women's human rights; delegates gathering at UN to assess situation adopt nonbinding declaration to abide by promises made at Beijing conference.

headline.main: U.N. Reveals ‘Alarmingly High’ Levels of Violence Against Women
headline.print_headline: U.N. Reveals ‘Alarmingly High’ Levels of Violence Against Women

snippet: The way we think about the turmoil in the Middle East and elsewhere is shaped by how we understand human rights....
lead_paragraph: This has been a year of uprisings. The series of popular revolts, struggles and crackdowns by governments, which continue to this day, began in Tunisia when protesters demanded the removal of president Zine al-Abidine Ben Ali.  The claims of the protesters were about the right to eat (the cost of food), political corruption, freedom of speech and basic political rights.  Then came Egypt, as thousands flocked to Tahrir Square in Cairo and elsewhere.  Their demands were similar to those in Tunisia. Both sets of protesters were successful: the leaders of both countries fled.  This was the first wave.  It was largely peaceful.
abstract: The way we think about the turmoil in the Middle East and elsewhere is shaped by how we understand human rights.

headline.main: Are There Natural Human Rights?

snippet: For more than 40 years, Gloria Steinem has been the near-singular voice of the women’s movement. Why, in all that time, has no one emerged as her successor?...
lead_paragraph: For more than 40 years, Gloria Steinem has been the near-singular voice of the women’s movement. Why, in all that time, has no one emerged as her successor?
abstract: Gloria Steinem, journalist and social and political activist, has been the near-singular voice of the women's movement for more than 40 years; question well worth asking in 2012 is why no one has emerged as her successor.

headline.seo: Gloria Steinem, a Woman Like No Other
headline.main: Gloria Steinem, a Woman Like No Other
headline.print_headline: A Woman Like No Other

lead_paragraph: A Nobel Peace Prize laureate’s personal story focuses a lens on human rights violations in Iran.
abstract: Jenny Nordberg reviews book Until We Are Free: My Fight for Human Rights in Iran by Shirin Ebadi.

headline.main: ‘Until We Are Free,’ by Shirin Ebadi
headline.print_headline: One for the Oppressed

lead_paragraph: The Israeli minister of culture and sports wants nothing less than an overthrow of the nation’s elite.

snippet: A leader who declared the church “open to all,” emphasizing women’s ordination, gay and lesbian congregants and civil rights....

headline.print_headline: Edmond Browning, Leader of Episcopalians, Dies at 87
